events.1774: Bentik, first Governor General of India, was born.
events.1820: Agri-Horticultural Garden of Calcutta started functioning.
events.1868: Swami Virjanand, Sanskrit grammar litterateur and master, passed away at the age of 90.
events.1893: Celebration of 'Sarvajanik Ganeshotsav' (Festival of Lord Ganesha) started.
events.1910: Dennis Laurence Amo, merchant and industrialist in Maharashtra, was born.
events.1919: Nyalchand Shah, bowled 64-33-97-3 in the Test between India vs Pakistan, was born at Dhragandhara in Gujarat.
events.1923: Ram Jethmalani, famous law expert and politician, was born.
events.1932: Durgavati Devi aka Durga Bhabhi, an revolutionary and freedom fighter, was born.
events.1933: Gandhi declares one-year moratorium on civil disobedience in India.
events.1949: Hindi declared the national language by the Constituent Assembly after a three-day debate.
events.1953: Andhra Pradesh was established. Hyderabad became the capital instead of Karnul.
events.1965: Pakistan Air Force bombs Calcutta and Agartala civilian airports.
events.1967: US announces plan to give India $1.3 million to buy contraceptives.
events.1971: Tarashankar Bandopadhyay, famous Bengali litterateur, died.
events.1991: Assam declared 'disturbed area', army launches 'Operation Rhino' against ULFA militants.
events.1992: S. A. Banerjee, cricketer who played one Test for India in 1948 without scoring any runs but took 5 wkts, died.
events.1997: Fire and explosions devastate terminals and storage tanks at Visakh Refinery of Hindustan Petroleum Corporation. Toll put at 51.
